Paper.Title: Unsupervised Part-of-Speech Tagging Employing Efficient Graph Clustering

Section.Paragraph: An unsupervised part-of-speech (POS) tagging system that relies on graph clustering methods is described. Unlike in current state-of-the-art approaches, the kind and number of different tags is generated by the method itself. We compute and merge two partitionings of word graphs: one based on context similarity of high frequency words, another on log-likelihood statistics for words of lower frequencies. Using the resulting word clusters as a lexicon, a Viterbi POS tagger is trained, which is refined by a morphological component.
The approach is evaluated on three different languages by measuring agreement with existing taggers.
